author: agemanning
content:
Sorry for the late reply. The lh nodes are up for me. 
However they won't respond to you if you have set your IP and Port in your ENR to a non-contactable address, i.e 127.0.0.1.

author: deme1744
content: Hmm, I just tried again and nothing. We are talking about the same nodes right? these: https://github.com/eth2-clients/eth2-mainnet/blob/master/bootnodes.txt#L16

author: deme1744
content: The nimbus implementation only allows 127.0.0.1 if you specifically request that address via cli option. So, yeah, I've tested with my real external IP and also with an ENR without IP, neither worked.

author: deme1744
content: I've also just now tested locally with a nimbus <-> lighthouse bootnode. I indeed saw that error when providing my external IP in the ENR (as the LH node notices the IP of my gateway). But once I tested without IP in ENR, or with 127.0.0.1 (so traffic stays local) in my ENR, it works. So nodes do seem to be compatible.

author: agemanning
content:
Yep, just checked again. That first ENR: `enr:-Jq4QN6_FzIYyfJET9hiLcGUsg_EVOwCQ4bwsBwe0S4ElrfXUXufSYLtQAHU9_LuO9uice7EAaLbDlMK8QEhtyg8Oh4BhGV0aDKQtTA_KgAAAAD__________4JpZIJ2NIJpcIQDGh4giXNlY3AyNTZrMaECSHaY_36GdNjF8-CLfMSg-8lB0wce5VRZ96HkT9tSkVeDdWRwgiMo`
with socket: 3.26.30.32:9000 works for me.

author: agemanning
content:
If you have rust/cargo installed, i'm checking with:
`cargo install discv5-cli`
`discv5-cli server -e <ENR>` 
It connects to the bootnode and discovers peers.

author: deme1744
content:
Ok, tried that. Doesn't seem to work either: 
```
2021-02-03 10:22:07,702 INFO  [discv5_cli::server::query_server] Query Completed. Nodes found: 0
2021-02-03 10:22:12,703 INFO  [discv5_cli::server::query_server] Connected Peers: 0
```
I've tried it with a Nimbus and Prysm bootnode, that did work.

author: deme1744
content: Strange. Some Geo-block somewhere on the route for me?

author: agemanning
content:
Hmm that is weird. You used the enr I mentioned above? 
The node should respond to the IP that sent the request. You don't have any special routing setup?

author: deme1744
content: Nothing special. Just behind NAT, but forwarded ports. Would be strange if it is setup related as I just used the discv5-cli server to bootstrap from a Nimbus and a Prysm node.

author: deme1744
content: And I've tested with providing my IP directly through the ``--enr-address`` option also

author: agemanning
content: Maybe shift this to DMs to spare others
